ticket.title: RFC-0032 Phase 3: implement work graph RPCs (Add/Remove/Waive) + `work_edges` projection + cycle detection

in_scope: Add runtime proto messages for AddWorkEdge/RemoveWorkEdge/WaiveWorkEdge requests including lease_id for authorization
Emit canonical `work_graph.edge.*` events with WorkGraphEvent protobuf payloads
Enforce idempotency: AddWorkEdge is idempotent on (from_work_id,to_work_id,edge_type,dedupe_key); derive edge_id deterministically when not supplied
Enforce authorization: edge mutations require COORDINATOR lease for to_work_id or daemon-internal system actor
Implement bounded cycle detection for active BLOCKS edges and reject edges that create cycles (fail-closed on bounds exceed)
Add `work_edges` projection table that is replayable from ledger events

steps: Extend runtime proto; implement dispatch handlers with CAS-free ledger append (graph events are protobuf payloads stored directly in ledger)
Implement deterministic edge_id derivation helper (EDGE- prefix) and enforce non-empty dedupe_key when edge_id absent
Add projection worker support: maintain active edge set + waivers + removals
Implement cycle detection using projection state (bounded DFS/BFS); reject on cycle or bound exceed
Add tests: idempotent add no duplicates; cycles rejected; waiver expiry honored

criteria: Graph edge mutations are replayable from ledger alone and are fully projection-derived (no WorkRegistry state).
Cycle detection is bounded and fail-closed.
Authorization is enforced via lease role; implementers cannot mutate graph without coordinator/system authority.

notes.security: Treat graph mutation as admission-critical; failures must be CAPABILITY_DENIED/CAPABILITY_REQUEST_REJECTED, not best-effort.

enforcement_requirements: Any new requirement, code path, or test added under this ticket must map to one or more required_invariants.
Any invariant relaxation requires explicit amendment in this ticket and the shared security model document.
Reviewer denial is expected for invariant-unmapped behavior changes.
